input_text:
Job Title: Lead Analytic Consultant, Analytics

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
About The Company

apree health – the new name for the joint Castlight Health and Vera Whole Health merger – is seeking an experienced healthcare analytic consultant to join our centralized Analytics team. We are entering an exciting new growth phase in which we are combining our individual company histories of top-rated digital/in-person navigation and the highly effective delivery of advanced primary care to launch exciting new differentiating solutions into the marketplace.

About The Team

The Analytics team is a group of highly skilled members who work together toward a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization. Our team uses a diverse array of data to provide analytic insights that support the entire organization, including Customer Success, Product Management, Sales and Marketing, and most recently, patient-care teams delivering Advanced Primary Care.

We are a collaborative, flexible, and friendly team that gets excited about data and analytics and the role they play in decision making. Our culture is one of teamwork, shared responsibility, mutual respect, and growth.

We operate on a Google Cloud Platform and utilize technical tools that include: SQL/DataGrip/Bigquery, Tableau, Alembic/Terraform, Gitlab, Python, Airflow, Mixpanel, R Studio, and SAS.

About The Job

Our Analytics team is seeking a Lead Analytic Consultant who will be responsible for delving into data and providing unique insights to specific high-profile customers who are key to the future success of our business. These customers each represent unique market opportunities for apree health, and each is considered a “pilot” for future growth opportunities for apree health.

The Lead Analytic Consultant will work as an embedded member of the Customer Team, with the role of providing key analytic insights to the rest of the team as well as directly to the customer. This includes ingesting and interpreting data, performing detailed analyses, responding to ad-hoc investigative requests, and summarizing insights driven by the analysis that answer the customer’s most pressing business questions.They will work shoulder to shoulder with the Customer Team, which includes business, clinical, and relationship leaders. At the same time, they will be responsible for bringing the learnings and approaches used back to the wider Analytics Team, and work to identify reusable components and techniques for future standardization.

This position requires direct customer consultative experience, along with demonstrated proficiency working with rich, multi-faceted data that includes administrative and clinical data.

This team member will report directly to the leader of the Emerging Solutions team within Analytics.

 Business Role and Responsibilities: 

 Partner with the assigned Customer Team to fully understand the key business priorities; clarify, prioritize, and clearly communicate the analytic questions to be answered  Design and execute analyses to support those priorities, including developing efficient SQL queries and any required visualizations  Collaborate with the Customer Team and other internal resources to identify key areas of opportunity for primary care management to improve outcomes and reduce cost across the population  Present resulting insights and associated recommendations to the Customer Team (and in some cases the Customer) in a succinct and effective way  Collaborate with and communicate to the wider Analytics team, identifying opportunities for standardization of approaches across current and future customers 

 Key Characteristics: 

 A natural “leader” who takes ownership of a challenge and sees it through to completion  A problem-solver with a natural sense of curiosity, an analytic mindset, and a deep love of extracting truth from data  Skilled at presenting complex analytic findings in a simple and understandable way to external and internal audiences  Self-sufficient, ready to roll up your sleeves, and not afraid of ambiguity  A detail-oriented individual who loves to create order out of chaos  Proven ability to work cross-functionally and build collaboration across many different stakeholder personas 

 Specific Requirements: 

 Minimum of 8 years’ experience in a healthcare-based analytics role  Minimum of 8 years experience working directly with administrative and/or clinical healthcare data (medical and pharmacy claims, EMR); familiarity with the standards and nuances of such data  Minimum of 3 years of direct customer-facing consultative experience  Minimum of 3 years experience performing population-health analytics, ideally for a commercially-insured population through the lens of a payer or self-insured employer  Technical experience that includes strong SQL capabilities, Tableau or other BI tools, scripting languages, Gitlab, etc  Health economics background or related experience tying financial and clinical outcomes to healthcare delivery patterns  Deep familiarity with U.S. healthcare insurance system and various types of payment arrangements  Bonus: Experience working for a local or national healthcare payer  Bonus: Experience working with primary care delivery systems and/or supporting value-based care relationships  Master’s degree in a quantitative/analytic field or equivalent work experience 

  Compensation: $130k-$175k/annual salary (national average, premium markets may vary)

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Design and execute analyses to support priorities
Develop efficient SQL queries and visualizations
Collaborate with the Customer Team and internal resources for opportunities
Collaborate with the wider Analytics team for standardization
output_json.company_information: apree health, formed by the merger of Castlight Health and Vera Whole Health, seeks an experienced healthcare analytic consultant for their Analytics team.

other.content: Minimum of 8 years’ experience in a healthcare-based analytics role; minimum of 8 years experience working directly with administrative and/or clinical healthcare data; minimum of 3 years of direct customer-facing consultative experience; minimum of 3 years experience performing population-health analytics; technical experience including strong SQL capabilities, Tableau or other BI tools, scripting languages, Gitlab; health economics background or related experience; deep familiarity with U.S. healthcare insurance system and various types of payment arrangements; bonus experiences; Master’s degree in a quantitative/analytic field or equivalent work experience.
